messages.message: Ah — not sure on that front.  @dlluncor and @sudeep would know more about the Dockerfile py2 v/s py3

here’s the current status of PY3 migration: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bKdDZPELc8noNMk1O578ZPrPIKzDj1OPPTqDHTybtDQ/edit?usp=drive_web&ouid=104653515690236512310

And added a comment here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YxMHM6KoPgLDaUUUKtaC3ju5bxF8aXeGMVmXQK7INSc/edit#

Note: In this spreadsheet when a service says PY3 default for runlocal, we encourage you to create a separate venv for Python3. Then you will run that service using your Python3 venv (since the run-local.sh script will be using the Python3.6 interpreter).

In contrast, our services run in Python2 and you should use your venv setup for Python2 for those.

If you want to experiment with “how does my service run in Python3”, you can do:

make build runlocal USE_PY3=true

In order to see if that takes effect, make sure to check out the Makefile to determine that USE_PY3 has been implemented for runlocal. An example of an implemented runlocal USE_PY3=true is here (app-tasks) or here (apps-server)
